title: Survey analysis based on a Kobo tool
text: version v0.0.3, kobo_select_one() uses information present dataset, retrieve labels Kobo tool. means provide lines responses chosen.
code: # With the labels, wonderful "var_label" and "var_value_label" # Choices is optional # Survey is mandatory kobo_select_one(design,                  vars = c("h_2_type_latrine", "admin1"),                  survey,                  choices,                  group = "milieu")  # For all select ones in the survey sheet kobo_select_one_all(design, survey, choices)

title: Survey analysis based on a Kobo tool
text: function deliberately conservative following: choice exists Kobo tool, dataset, removed calculation; choice exists dataset, Kobo tool, taken account; example, choice added recoded cleaning, Kobo tool must updated beforehand (goes hand hand good practice --date Kobo tool can used dictionary variables; input filtered survey sheet variables corresponding data (main, hh roster, education loop, etc.).
code: # With the labels, note the "choices_sep" argument # that allows for choosing the choice separator in the database # either a "/" or "." or a "_" , etc. # It still only accepts one variable # Arg 'vars' can take a vector of select_multiple variables kobo_select_multiple(design, c("e_typ_ecole", "e_typ_ecole"), survey, choices, choices_sep = "_")  # For all select multiples kobo_select_multiple_all(design, survey, choices, choices_sep = "_")

what: Mean and median for numeric variables (decimal, integer, calculate)
title: Survey analysis based on a Kobo tool
code: # Mean for one or several numeric variables kobo_mean(design, c("c_total_3_17_femmes", "e_abandont_3a_4a_fille"), survey)  # Median for one or several numeric variables kobo_median(design, "f_5_depenses_ba", survey, group = "milieu")  # Do the same for all variables kobo_mean_all(design, survey) kobo_median_all(design,survey)

what: Ratio for numeric variables (decimal, integer, calculate)
title: Survey analysis based on a Kobo tool
code: kobo_ratio(design, nums = "e_abandont_3a_4a_fille", denoms = "c_total_3_17_femmes", survey = survey)

what: Interaction of variables (e.g. for needs profiles)
title: Survey analysis based on a Kobo tool
code: kobo_interact(design, c("h_2_type_latrine", "e_typ_ecole_publique"), survey = survey)

title: Survey analysis based on a Kobo tool
text: auto_kobo_analysis() function runs functions kobo_ratio() . functions provide quick workflow analyzing survey data, recommend way provide data analysis plan use functions kobo_analysis() kobo_analysis_dap() (see ), allows finer analyses (e.g. providing ratios, labels indicators, etc., beyond types defined Kobo tool.)

title: Survey analysis based on a Kobo tool
code: # Calculate a mean kobo_analysis(design, analysis = "mean", vars = c("c_total_3_17_femmes", "e_abandont_3a_4a_fille"), survey)  # Calculate a median kobo_analysis(design, analysis = "median", vars = "f_5_depenses_ba", survey)  # Calculate a ratio proportion kobo_analysis(design, analysis = "ratio", vars = c("e_abandont_3a_4a_fille" = "c_total_3_17_femmes"), survey)  # Calculate a select_one proportion kobo_analysis(design, analysis = "select_one", vars = c("h_2_type_latrine", "admin1"), survey, choices, na_rm = F)  # Calculate a select_multiple proportion kobo_analysis(design, analysis = "select_multiple", vars = "e_typ_ecole", survey, choices)  # Calculat the proportio of an interaction kobo_analysis(design, analysis = "interact", vars = c("h_2_type_latrine", "e_typ_ecole_publique"), survey)

what: Make your own analysis using a data analysis plan
title: Survey analysis based on a Kobo tool
text: Necessary columns : analysis, vars, na_rm. arguments passed whole data analysis plan, e.g. group, level, vartype, etc. columns, instance useful reporting indicator name sector, kept. function runs : separate dataframe lists analysis type map analysis type bind left_join columns contain one variable analyze per row (case ratio two variables calculate ratio separated comma case interaction variables separated comma). package contains example: , run analysis, following:
code: analysis_dap |> dplyr::as_tibble() #> # A tibble: 6 × 6 #>   sector              indicator                      var   analysis na_rm subset #>   <chr>               <chr>                          <chr> <chr>    <chr> <chr>  #> 1 General information Mean of the number of school-… c_to… mean     yes   House… #> 2 Expenses            Median of food expenses        f_5_… median   yes   NA     #> 3 Education           A ratio that does not really … e_ab… ratio    yes   Maybe… #> 4 Sanitation          % of households by type of la… h_2_… select_… no    NA     #> 5 Education           % of households by type of sc… e_ty… select_… yes   House… #> 6 Education           % of households by type of sc… e_ty… select_… no    NA # Default kobo_analysis_from_dap(design, analysis_dap, survey, choices, choices_sep = "_")  # Grouped and confidence level of 0.99 kobo_analysis_from_dap(design, analysis_dap, survey, choices, group = "milieu", level = 0.99, choices_sep = "_")

title: Analyzing survey data (collected with Kobo)
text: Faster simpler survey analysis.

title: Analyzing survey data (collected with Kobo)
text: can install development version impactR.analysis GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("gnoblet/impactR.analysis")

what: The svy_*() family, wrappers around srvyr functions.
title: Analyzing survey data (collected with Kobo)
text: impactR.analysis contains prepared objects: survey (survey) choices (choices) sheets Kobo, srvyr design object (design). Let’s start examples svy_*() family wrappers arounds srvyr package standardized outputs. Around functions, two ‘master’ functions:
code: library(impactR.analysis)  # Get proportion for a variable (not kobo related) # check the help ?svy_prop() svy_prop(design, vars = "h_2_type_latrine")  # Get proportion with a grouping column and for two vars # This grouping parameter exists for all svy family function # It can be a vector of grouping columns svy_prop(design, vars = c("h_2_type_latrine", "admin1"), group = "milieu")  # Same thing with mean or median  # % of HHs attending public schools with the dummy variable svy_mean(design, vars = "e_typ_ecole_publique") # Median of the # of female age 3-17 yo svy_median(design, vars = "c_total_3_17_femmes")  # Interaction between variables (e.g. for needs profiles) # Does it mean something here? svy_interact(design, c("h_2_type_latrine", "e_typ_ecole_publique"))  # there is also svy_quantile() and svy_ratio() # and two svy_test_*() functions svy_quantile(design, vars = c("f_5_depenses_ba", "e_typ_ecole_publique")) svy_ratio(design, nums = c("e_typ_ecole_publique", "e_typ_ecole_publique"), denoms = c("e_typ_ecole_non_publique", "e_typ_ecole_publique")) # A master analysis function, you can use "analysis" as the type of analysis. See the function's details svy_analysis(design,               analysis = "prop",              vars = c("h_2_type_latrine", "e_typ_ecole"))  # For ratios, provide a named vector of num = denom variables svy_analysis(design,              analysis = "ratio",              vars = c("e_typ_ecole_publique" = "e_typ_ecole_publique", "e_typ_ecole_non_publique" = "e_typ_ecole_publique"))  # Then there is this dirty automated function auto_svy_analysis(design)

title: Auto survey from a Kobo tool analysis — auto_kobo_analysis
code: auto_kobo_analysis(   design,   survey,   choices,   group = NULL,   group_key_sep = " -/- ",   na_rm = TRUE,   vartype = "ci",   level = 0.95,   choices_sep = "/",   label_survey = TRUE,   bind = TRUE )

title: Auto survey from a Kobo tool analysis — auto_kobo_analysis
text: design srvyr::design object. survey survey sheet. choices choices sheet. group quoted vector columns group . Default NULL group. group_key_sep character string separate grouping column names fancy 'group_key' column. na_rm NAs var removed? Default TRUE. vartype Report variability one : standard error ("se", default), confidence interval ("ci"), variance ("var") coefficient variation ("cv"). level (vartype = "ci" ) single number vector numbers indicating confidence level choices_sep Select multiples choices separator. label_survey Boolean. Retrieve questions label survey sheet? Default TRUE. bind Boolean. Output dataframe list?

title: Kobo survey analysis — kobo_analysis
text: design srvyr::design object. analysis Analysis type. See details , well, details. vars variable calculate . survey survey sheet Kobo (column "type" split). See split_survey(). choices choices sheet Kobo. group quoted vector columns group . Default NULL group. group_key_sep character string separate grouping column names fancy 'group_key' column. auto_group_remove TRUE, analysis run vars group. Default TRUE. label_survey Boolean. Retrieve var's label survey sheet? Default TRUE. label_choices Boolean. Retrieve choices label choices sheet? Default TRUE. na_rm NAs var removed? Default TRUE. vartype Report variability one : standard error ("se", default), confidence interval ("ci"), variance ("var") coefficient variation ("cv"). level (vartype = "ci" ) single number vector numbers indicating confidence level ratio_key_sep separator ratio key. interact_key_sep character string separate interactions columns fancy 'interact_key" column. choices_sep Select multiples choices separator.

title: Kobo survey analysis — kobo_analysis
text: survey-summarized-median data frame

title: Kobo survey analysis — kobo_analysis
text: possible analysis type : mean kobo_mean(), median kobo_median(), select_one kobo_select_one(), select_multiple kobo_select_multiple(), ratio kobo_ratio(). now also incldues interactions variables kobo_interact() using analysis = "interact"? analysis "ratio": vars takes named vector. Names passed nums svy_ratio() values denoms. choices NULL, function tries retrieve labels select_one, mandatory select_multiple, used mean, median, ratio.

text: kobo_analysis_from_dap performs survey analysis data analysis plan, kobo_analysis_from_dap_group wrapper around former run multiple grouped analyses .

code: kobo_analysis_from_dap(   design,   dap,   survey,   choices,   group = NULL,   level = 0.95,   choices_sep = "/" )  kobo_analysis_from_dap_group(   design,   dap,   survey,   choices,   l_group,   no_group = TRUE,   level = 0.95,   choices_sep = "/" )

title: Kobo survey analysis from a data analysis plan — kobo_analysis_from_dap
text: design srvyr::design object. dap well formatted data analysis plan. survey survey sheet Kobo (column "type" split). See split_survey(). choices choices sheet Kobo. group quoted vector columns group . Default NULL group. level (vartype = "ci" ) single number vector numbers indicating confidence level choices_sep Select multiples choices separator. l_group list vectors variables group . no_group TRUE, analysis without grouping run.

title: Get the median for a numeric var — kobo_median
text: design srvyr::design object. vars Variables calculate median . survey survey sheet Kobo (column "type" split). See impactR.kobo::split_survey(). group quoted vector columns group . Default NULL group. group_key_sep character string separate grouping column names fancy 'group_key' column. label_survey Boolean. Retrieve var's label survey sheet? Default TRUE. na_rm NAs var removed? Default TRUE. vartype NULL report variability. Otherwise one : standard error ("se", default), confidence interval ("ci"), variance ("var") coefficient variation ("cv"). level single number indicating confidence level (one level allowed). Note may effect estimated standard errors (see svyquantile details alpha, equals 1-level).

Default NULL group. group_key_sep character string separate grouping column names fancy 'group_key' column. label_survey Boolean. Retrieve questions label survey sheet? Default TRUE. na_rm NAs var removed? Default TRUE. vartype Report variability one : standard error ("se", default), confidence interval ("ci"), variance ("var") coefficient variation ("cv"). level (vartype = "ci" ) single number vector numbers indicating confidence level

title: Survey analysis — svy_analysis
code: svy_analysis(   design,   analysis,   vars,   group = NULL,   group_key_sep = " -/- ",   na_rm = TRUE,   vartype = "ci",   level = 0.95,   ratio_key_sep = " -/- ",   interact_key_sep = " -/- ",   quantiles = c(0.25, 0.5, 0.75),   ak = TRUE,   ak_overall_sep = " @/@ ",   ak_main_sep = " -/-",   ak_var_to_value_sep = " %/% ",   ... )

title: Survey analysis — svy_analysis
text: design srvyr::design object. analysis Analysis type. See details , well, details. vars variable calculate . group quoted vector columns group . Default NULL group. group_key_sep character string separate grouping column names fancy 'group_key' column. na_rm NAs var removed? Default TRUE. vartype Report variability one : standard error ("se", default), confidence interval ("ci"), variance ("var") coefficient variation ("cv"). level single number vector numbers indicating confidence level ratio_key_sep separator ratio key. interact_key_sep character string separate interactions columns fancy 'interact_key" column. quantiles vector quantiles calculate ak Boolean. Add analysis key? ak_overall_sep overall separator items, e.g. type analysis variables information. ak_main_sep main separator variables, e.g. two grouping columns. ak_var_to_value_sep separator variable value. ... parameters pass used srvyr method.

title: Survey analysis — svy_analysis
text: survey-summarized-median data frame

title: Survey analysis — svy_analysis
text: possible analysis type : mean svy_mean(), median svy_median(), interact svy_interact(), proportion svy_proportion(), ratio svy_ratio(), quantile svy_quantile(). analysis "ratio": vars takes named vector. Names passed nums svy_ratio() values denoms. analysis "interact": vars equivalent interact.

Default TRUE. vartype Report variability one : standard error ("se", default), confidence interval ("ci"), variance ("var") coefficient variation ("cv"). level (vartype = "ci" ) single number vector numbers indicating confidence level ak Boolean. Add analysis key? ak_overall_sep overall separator items, e.g. type analysis variables information. ak_main_sep main separator variables, e.g. two grouping columns. ak_var_to_value_sep separator variable value. ... parameters pass srvyr::survey_mean().

title: Survey median — svy_median
text: design srvyr::design object. vars variable calculate median . group quoted vector columns group . Default NULL group. group_key_sep character string separate grouping column names fancy 'group_key' column. na_rm NAs var removed? Default TRUE. vartype NULL report variability. Otherwise one : standard error ("se", default), confidence interval ("ci"), variance ("var") coefficient variation ("cv"). level single number indicating confidence level (one level allowed). Note may effect estimated standard errors (see svyquantile details alpha, equals 1-level). ak Boolean. Add analysis key? ak_overall_sep overall separator items, e.g. type analysis variables information. ak_main_sep main separator variables, e.g. two grouping columns. ak_var_to_value_sep separator variable value. ... parameters pass srvyr::survey_median().

title: impactR.analysis 0.0.5
text: New: added auto_group_remove parameter kobo_analysis(), made automatically remove grouping columns analysis (#21). New: added kobo_interact() function, wrapper around svy_interact() calculate proportions interactions variables. Change: kobo_analysis() kobo_analysis_from_dap() calculates interactions vars analysis = "interact".

title: impactR.analysis 0.0.4
text: Update: default choices_sep now “/”. Update: analysis key updated (see #11). New: kobo_analysis_from_dap_group() wrapper around kobo_analysis_from_dap() function, list grouping vectors (#15).

title: impactR.analysis 0.0.3
text: Breaking change new: kobo_*() family functions make use svy_*() family Kobo tools. Previous functions renamed updated prop_*. New: auto_kobo_analysis() provides basic automated analysis, kobo_analysis_from_dap() allows providing data analysis plan.

title: impactR.analysis 0.0.2
text: Breaking change: svy_*() functions now uses non regex key separators ak = TRUE, ak parameter gives analysis key. apply svy_quantile() svy_test_*() functions.

title: impactR.analysis 0.0.1
text: Breaking change: svy_*() functions now needs quoted vectors, svy_test_*() functions. Addendum: svy_*() family now allows multiple variables arg vars. concern svy_test_*() functions.(#1) Addendum: proportion_select_one also allows multiple select ones. New: svy_analysis() wrapper around svy_*() family. concern svy_test_*() functions. (#2) New: auto_svy_analysis() small dirty automation (#2).
